intro: Silene cretica, commonly known as common mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, and it often grows in grassy areas or along roadsides. Silene cretica is part of the Caryophyllaceae family, known for its showy blooms and medicinal uses in traditional herbal remedies.
